prompt.content: I would like to open an account with my son, do u have any product for kids?

completion.content: Yes our product is Little Champs Account. It is designed specifically for minors (individuals below the age of 18 years). A child requires the help of a parental/legal guardian to open this account and avail its facilities. Little Champs get a Debit Card and chequebook which is free the first time

prompt.content: What are the main Features  of the Little Champs Account.

completion.content: Minimum initial deposit of Rs.100/-

prompt.content: What other Value added features does the Little Champs Account have?

completion.content: Attractive returns on savings account

prompt.content: What is the account type of Little Champs Account is it saving or current ?

completion.content: This account is offered both in current and savings categories

prompt.content: How can the minor operate this account?

completion.content: This account is opened in the name of the minor. However, a minor needs a guardian’s help to avail the account’s facilities

prompt.content: What documents are required to open a Little Champs Account.

completion.content: ·        A photocopy of Form-B, Birth Certificate or Student ID card (as appropriate) of the minor

prompt.content: 1.What are the benefits of NUST Bank Auto Finance?
2. Who can apply for NUST Auto Finance?

completion.content: ·        Salaried Individuals

prompt.content: 3. Which types of Vehicles are offered under NUST auto finance?

completion.content: Locally assembled/manufactured

prompt.content: 4. Can I avail Loan Facility, if there are defaults against my previous loan(s)?

completion.content: No. Regular payment against previous loans is necessary.

prompt.content: 5. How much loan can I avail?

completion.content: Up to a maximum of Rs.3 Million from all banks/DFIs in aggregate, subject to a maximum of 40% Debt Burden requirement.

prompt.content: 6. What is maximum period of loan?

completion.content: Up to 1000 CC Vehicles                                       up to 5 Years

prompt.content: 7. How much Equity/Down Payment is required?

completion.content: Minimum 30%  equity +(1st Year Insurance + documentation charges) is required as down payment

prompt.content: 8. Can I avail more than one vehicle through Auto loan facility?

completion.content: Yes. Two vehicles can be availed simultaneously from NUST Bank, subject to Debt Burden Limitations

prompt.content: Professional?

completion.content: Yes. The individual  with  foreign remittance, supported by Bank statement  and remittance receipts can avail Auto Loan Facility

prompt.content: 10. Are there any hidden charges?

completion.content: There are no hidden charges. All charges are mentioned in our Schedule of Charges available at our website and at all branches of NUST Bank.

prompt.content: 11. Is insurance of vehicle is mandatory?

completion.content: Yes. Comprehensive Insurance of vehicle is mandatory for the whole tenor of loan at the cost of the borrower

prompt.content: 12. What will be the monthly insurance charges on the vehicle valuing Rs.3 million?

completion.content: With the current insurance rate of 1.75% per annum, it will be Rs.4,375/- per month.

prompt.content: 13. Who will insure my Vehicle?

completion.content: NUST Bank has insurance arrangements with reputed insurance companies with attractive insurance rate,

prompt.content: 14. Can I pay my loan before maturity?

completion.content: Yes. You can pay your loan before maturity. However, charges shall be applicable as per prevailing SOC

prompt.content: 15. What is the security against the loan?

completion.content: Financed vehicle will be the security against the loan, which will be hypothecated in favour of NUST Bank.

prompt.content: 16. Whether bank is responsible for delay in booking or delivery of vehicle?

completion.content: No. Bank does not assume any responsibility in this regard, as same is beyond the control of bank.

prompt.content: 17. Whether bank is responsible for any type of dispute related to Warranty/Fault in vehicle/Service issues with Dealership or vehicle Manufacturer?

completion.content: No. Bank does not assume this responsibility. Customer will take up the matter directly with dealership or manufacturer.

prompt.content: 18. What is the Loan Application processing time?

completion.content: The processing time for loan approval is approximately 11 working days, subject to complete application with required documents/formalities.

prompt.content: 19. How can I apply for loan?

completion.content: You can apply by visiting any of our  Branch or by calling us at 24 hours Contact Centre at 111-000-787.

prompt.content: Who can apply for NUST Personal Finance?

completion.content:
1· Armed Forces Officers
	 - Serving employees
	 - Retired employees

2.	JCOs/Equivalent & Lower Cadres
	 - Serving employees
	 - Retired employees

3.	Allied Armed Forces (SPD & its allied concerns) and Civilians (in GHQ/NHQ & AHQ)
	 - Serving employees (Permanent & Contractual Employees)

4.	Fauji Foundation Group
	 - Permanent employees
	 - Contractual employees

prompt.content: Can overseas Pakistanis obtain Personal Finance facility from NUST?

completion.content: No, the availability of applicants & their employers is mandatory within Pakistan for applying clean Personal Finance.

prompt.content: What is the minimum and maximum financing amount?

completion.content: The minimum financing amount is Rs. 50,000/ (Rs. 35,000 for retired JCOs & Lower Cadre - Subject to pension with NUST).

prompt.content: What are the minimum & maximum financing tenures?

completion.content: Minimum 01 year

prompt.content: What is the age criteria for applying NUST Personal Finance?

completion.content:
Minimum:
Salaried:  21 years (18 years for Armed Forces)
SEB/SEP:  23 years
Prime Customers:  25 years

prompt.content: What is the minimum monthly income criterion?

completion.content:
Salaried (Approved Company):
 - Category A Company - PKR 40,000 (Permanent) & PKR 60,000 (Company / 3rd Party Contractual)
 - Category B & C Company - PKR 50,000 (Permanent) & PKR 60,000 (Company / 3rd Party Contractual)

Salaried (Non-approved Company):
 - PKR 70,000 (Permanent) & PKR 80,000 (Company Contractual)

Salaried (GOP):
 - Serving - PKR 35,000 (Permanent, BPS-5 & above) & PKR 45,000 (Contractual)
 - Retired - PKR 40,000 subject to pension with NUST

prompt.content: In which area of the country one can avail Personal Finance form NUST?

completion.content: Personal Finance can be availed from all cities where NUST branches exists.

prompt.content: What is the Application processing time?

completion.content: The processing time of Personal Finance is 10 working days form login till approval (subject to complete application with required documents).

prompt.content: What is the Application processing Charges?

completion.content: It will be as per prevailing Schedule of Charges (SOC) or As per corporate arrangement.

prompt.content: What is the repayment mode?

completion.content: Payment of Equal Monthly Instalment (EMI) comprising of principal, mark-up and insurance payment will be made through Direct Debit Authority (DDA) of borrower’s account maintained with NUST.

prompt.content: Can I make balloon payments or premature termination of facility?

completion.content:
Yes, Balloon payment or premature termination option is available for all customers.
Charges will be applied as per prevailing Bank’s schedule of charges / As per corporate arrangement.

prompt.content: What happens if I fail to fulfil your payment obligations?

completion.content: In case of overdue / default, recovery department of NUST will contact you, your loan related details will be reported to Credit Bureau.

prompt.content: How will I get update of my Personal Loan Application?

completion.content: You can visit/ call or send email at our Customer Services centre(s) as well.

prompt.content: 1.Who can apply for NUST Credit Card Facility?

completion.content: Salaried Individuals

prompt.content: 2.What is the minimum age for applying NUST Mastercard Credit Card?

completion.content: Minimum 21 years old & Pakistani resident, can apply for NUST MasterCard Credit Card.

prompt.content: 3. What is the maximum age for applying NUST Mastercard Credit Card?

completion.content: Salaried (Permanent):  60 years

prompt.content: 4.Can overseas Pakistanis obtain Credit Card facility from NUST?

completion.content: Yes. The individuals maintaining FC account with NUST, Remittances/ Roshan Digital Account holders/

prompt.content: 5. What is the minimum and maximum financing amount?

completion.content: Clean facility, Minimum Rs. 30,000/- and maximum up to 3.0 Million or as per 40% Debt Burden Ratio subject to SBP PRs.

prompt.content: 6. What would be the financing tenure?

completion.content: NUST Credit Card is an Evergreen facility & renewable after expiry of credit card.

prompt.content: 7. What is the minimum monthly income criterion?

completion.content: GOP / Semi Govt. / Autonomous Bodies etc: Permanent, Rs. 35,000/- Contractual, Rs. 45,000/-

prompt.content: 8. In which area of the country one can avail Credit Card facility?

completion.content: Credit Card can be availed from all cities / Areas without discrimination

prompt.content: 9. What is the Application processing time?

completion.content: The processing time of Credit Card facility is 10 working days form login till approval subject to complete application with required documentation

prompt.content: 10. What are the Application Processing Charges?

completion.content: Processing Charges will be as per prevailing Bank’s Schedule of Charges (SOC).

prompt.content: 11. What happens if I fail to fulfil your payment obligations?

completion.content: In case of overdue / default, recovery department of NUST will contact you, your loan related details will be reported to Credit Bureau. Late payment and cheque return charges may also be applicable as per prevailing schedule of charges. Legal proceeding may also be initiated by the Bank.

prompt.content: 12. How will I get update of my Credit Card Application?

completion.content: You can visit/ call or send email at our Customer Services centre(s) as well. Services centre(s) as well.

prompt.content: 13. Is there a limit to international Spending?

completion.content: As per SBP directives i.e. Nov 1, 2022 industry-wide annual maximum limit of USD 30,000/- per individual on card-based

prompt.content: 1.What types of Housing Finance products does NUST offer?

completion.content: Purchase of House/ Apartment/ Flat/ Residential Unit

prompt.content: 2.What is the minimum age for applying NUST Mortgage Finance?

completion.content: Salaried : 21 Years

prompt.content: 3. What is the Maximum age criteria for applying NUST Mortgage Finance?

completion.content:
Salaried Permanent : 60 Years at the maturity of loan
Salaried Contractual: 65 Years at the Matrurity of loan
Pensioners: 65 Years at the maturity of loan
SEB/SEP: 65 Years at the maturity of loan

prompt.content: 4.Can overseas Pakistanis obtain House Finance facility from NUST?

completion.content: Yes. However can apply as Co-Borrower with veriable income. Basic borrower from Pakistan should also meet the required basic criteria for MF.

prompt.content: 5. What is the minimum and maximum financing amount?

completion.content:
The minimum financing amount is Rs. 500,000/. 
The maximum financing limit will be up to Rs.100,000,000/- subject to 50% Debt Burden Ratio(DBR) as per SBP PRs for Housing Finance.

prompt.content: 6. What would be the financing tenure?

completion.content: Loan tenure is Minimum 3 years and maximum 25 years

prompt.content: 7. Can I obtain financing on my owned property by mortgaging it?

completion.content: Yes, purpose of finance has to be in line with the purpose defined by regulator i.e.

prompt.content: 8. Can I avail more than one House loan?

completion.content: Yes. One can avail two Mortgage Loans at a time from NUST Bank within Debt Burden Ratio (DBR) as per prevailing SBP PRs for Housing Finance.

prompt.content: 9. Can I avail income tax rebate on House Financing?

completion.content: Yes, one can claim tax rebate against its House Finance mark-up paid during the year, or as per prevailing Tax laws of the country.

prompt.content: 10. What is the minimum monthly income criterion?

completion.content: Salaried: Permanent Rs. 50,000/-, Contractual Rs. 60,000/-, Govt. Employee Contractual 75,000/-

prompt.content: 11. Can I club income of Co-Borrower?

completion.content: Yes. Clubbing of Co-Borrower income may be allowed in case of spouse/son/parents/un-married daughter/Sibling.

prompt.content: 12. What are the processing charges for NUST Mortgage FInance?

completion.content: Processing Charges will be as per prevailing Bank’s Schedule of Charges (SOC).

prompt.content: 13. What is the repayment mode?

completion.content: Payment of Equal Monthly Installment (EMI) comprising of principal, mark-up and Insurance cost etc. will be made through Direct Debit Authority (DDA) of borrower’s account maintained with NUST.

prompt.content: 14. Is Property insurance coverage mandatory?

completion.content: Yes. Property Insurance is mandatory; Insurance premium is born by the borrower. It covers construction cost of financed house and value of property in case of apartment.

prompt.content: 15. Can I make balloon payments or premature termination is allowed?

completion.content: Yes, Balloon payment or premature termination option is available for all customers. Charges will be applied as per prevailing Bank’s schedule of charges.

prompt.content: 16. Can the loan amount be used for any other purpose?

completion.content: No, the loan amount can only be used for specific purpose i.e.

prompt.content: 17.In which area of the country one can avail House Finance form NUST?

completion.content: Mortgage Finance facility can be availed from all cities / areas without discrimination.

prompt.content: 18. Where financing is not allowed?

completion.content: The financing shall not be allowed for;

prompt.content: 14. What is the Application processing time?

completion.content: The processing time of Mortgage Finance is 30 days form login till approval subject to complete application with required documents.

prompt.content: How will I get update of my House Loan Application?

completion.content: Our Sales/ front end staff is quite supportive and always there to serve you. You can visit/call or send email at our Customer Services center(s) as well.

prompt.content: Is NUST Bank offering any financing specifically for women owned small and medium enterprises?

completion.content: The Product "NUST Sahar Finance" is based on Refinance and Credit Guarantee Scheme for Women Entrepreneurs objective of this product is to provide financing facilities to women owned enterprises to meet credit needs of their businesses.

prompt.content: What are the purposes for which NUST Sahar Finance can be availed?

completion.content:
i. Expansion of existing business
ii. Set up of new business
iii.Purchase of stocks/ Working Capital Requirement etc

prompt.content: What is the applicant legal structure of business in order to avail NUST Sahar Finance?

completion.content:
Sole Proprietor, Partnership Firm, Private Limited Company, Single Member Company (SMC), Business Individuals (Women Owned)

*In Partnership firm/ Private Limited Company, having 02 partners or directors, minimum 51% shareholder/ CEO should be a a femle who should also be the applicant. If there are more than 02 partners or directors, major share holder should be women , who should also be CEO and applicant

prompt.content: What is the nature of finance in NUST Sahar Finance?

completion.content:
i. Long Term Finance
ii. Short Term Finance/Working Capital

prompt.content: What is the maximum tenure of NUST Sahar Finance?

completion.content:
Short Term Finance/Working Capital
Maximum 3 years with no grace period

prompt.content: Is there any age criteria to avail NUST Sahar Finance?

completion.content:
New Business
Between 20-50 years at the time of application

prompt.content: What are the Loan Limits of NUST Sahar Finance?

completion.content:
New Business
Maximum Loan Rs: 3.00 Million

prompt.content: What is the current Mark-up rate of NUST Sahar Finance?

completion.content:
Mark-up Rate of @5% p.a.
*Markup at 12M Kibor + 4% Per Annum to be charged till refinance claim reimbursed by SBP.

prompt.content: Can applicant avail clean loan in NUST Sahar Finance?

completion.content: Max Rs: 0.70 million can be availed against personal and third party guarantee

prompt.content: Does the bank require any Equity for this scheme?

completion.content:
New Business
20% equity.

prompt.content: Is there any minimum business age requirement?

completion.content:
Existing Business Should be women owned enterprises with Minimum 01 year of business registration
New Business: Nil

prompt.content: What are the processing charges for NUST Sahar Finance Application?

completion.content: Up to Rs. 0.70

prompt.content: Are there any late payment charges?

completion.content:
Rs. 1,000/- per installment
*In case of delay of installment, commercial rate will be charged on the outstanding principal amount.

prompt.content: What are the service/documentation/legal charges in NUST Sahar Finance?

completion.content: At actual

prompt.content: What are the insurance charges?

completion.content: At actual

prompt.content: Is NUST Bank offering any financing specifically for the ownership & capacity enhancement of business premises?

completion.content: NUST Bank has structured a new financing product “NUST Imarat Finance” under the ambit of SME segment. The Product Program has been developed in order to stabilize SME business through making their ownership of business premises (under mortgage finance of urban commercial / industrial buildings) for capacity enhancement of SMEs.The product has been structured for SMEs owned by general public as well as retired armed forces officers and families of serving officers.

prompt.content: For which purpose NUST Imarat Finance is being offered?

completion.content:
AIF 1:   Acquisition / Purchase of urban commercial / industrial construted property/ office and commercial premises for commercial / business activity
AIF 2:   Construction on self owned urban commercial / Industrial plot
AIF 3:   Additional construction on already built urban commercial/ industrial plaza/building
AIF 4:   Renovation of self owned urban commercial /industrial property/Plaza/ business premises

prompt.content: What are the Loan Limits of NUST Imarat Finance?

completion.content:
AIF 1:   Mininum Rs. 5.00 M & Maximum Rs. 100M 
AIF 2:   Mininum Rs. 5.00 M & Maximum Rs. 50M 
AIF 3:   Maximum Rs. 30M or upto 30% of FSV of offered property, whichever is lower
AIF 4:   Maximum Rs. 5M or upto 25% of FSV of offered property, whichever is lower

prompt.content: What is the maximum tenure of NUST Imarat Finance?

completion.content: AIF 1:  Maximum 10 Years (Grace Period upto 6 months)

prompt.content: Does the bank require any Equity for this scheme?

completion.content:
AIF 1 & AIF 2: Minimum 30%  (Existing business) & Minimum 40% (New Business)
AIF 3 & AIF 4 : Nil for Existing business & Minimum 25% (New Business)

prompt.content: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in NUST Imarat Finance?

completion.content:
New Business
Minimum 30 years at the time of application, however age not to exceed 60 years at maturity of loan.

prompt.content: Any mandatory qualification/experience required?

completion.content:
Specifically for New Business: 
i)	Only Professionals i.e. Chartered Accountants, Doctors, Engineers, IT Professionals, and consultants etc, with minimum 02 years professional experience. 
ii)	Retired professionals from armed forces and families of serving armed forces officers

prompt.content: What is the current Mark-up rate of NUST Imarat Finance?

completion.content:
General Regular SME’s 
End-user Rate: 12MK+4% p.a. (to be reviewed on annual basis)

prompt.content: Is there any business age requirement?

completion.content: Existing Business Minimum 03 year operating history of business

prompt.content: What should be the legal structure of business for availing  NUST Imarat Finance?

completion.content: Sole Proprietor, Partnership Firm(registered), Private Limited Company, Limited Company

prompt.content: What is the security requirement for availing NUST Imarat Finance?

completion.content:
i.	Effective Mortgage (Equitable / or token registered) to be created on same urban Commercial / Industrial property which has been financed
ii.	03 post dated cheques of the full loan amount plus markup
iii.	Personal Guarantees from borrowers, all partners and directors of the companies alongwith “Personal Net worth Statement”.
iv.	Fard based property to be registered equivalent to the full loan amount

prompt.content: What is the repayment frequency in NUST Imarat Finance?

completion.content: Monthly/Quarterly

prompt.content: Is there any condition related to bank account maintenance for availing NUST Imarat Finance?

completion.content:
Minimum 01 year bank account statement with NUST
                                       Or
Minimum 02 years bank statement with any other bank

prompt.content: Is there any penalty charges related to Premature termination/balloon payment penalties?

completion.content: Mode of Pre-Mature termination

prompt.content: What are the processing charges for NUST Imarat Finance Application?

completion.content: Rs 30,000/- or 0.2% of loan amount whichever is higher (Non-refundable)

prompt.content: Are there any late payment charges?

completion.content: Rs. 3,000/- per installment

prompt.content: What are the service/documentation/legal charges in NUST Imarat Finance?

completion.content: At actual

prompt.content: What are the valuation/BOQ charges?

completion.content: At actual

prompt.content: Is NUST Bank offering any financing product related to renewable/alternate energy solutions?

completion.content: NUST Bank has structured a new financing product under the name of “NUST Ujala Finance (NUST Ujala Finance)” in light of SBP’s refinance scheme, under the ambit of SME. The Product Program has been developed to provide financing for installation of solar energy equipment as an alternate source of energy.

prompt.content: who can apply for NUST Ujala Finance?

completion.content:
1. 	SE/ME Financing 
2. 	Vendor’s / Suppliers’ Financing 
3. 	NUST Employees’ Financing   
4. 	Domestic Applicant Financing (exclusively for employees of corporate / government sector)

prompt.content: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in NUST Ujala Finance?

completion.content:
SE/ME Financing:  Between 25-55 years at the time of application. (Any one partner/ director should meet age criteria)
Vendors/Suppliers: Between 25-55 years at the time of application. (Any one partner/ director should meet age criteria)
NUST Employees’ Financing: No age limit   
Domestic Applicant Financing: Between 25-55 years at the time of application. (Any one borrower or co-borrower should meet criteria)

prompt.content: For which purposes NUST Ujala Finance is being offered?

completion.content: SME, NUST Employees and Domestic: Energy generation for own use or for supply to the distribution company / NEPRA

prompt.content: Capacity allowed under NUST Ujala Finance?

completion.content:
i. Business Enterprise : SE from 10 KW to 200KW, ME from 30 KW to 500KW
ii. Domestic Borrowers from 5 KW to 30KW
iii. NUST employees : upto 30 KW.
Iv. Vendors/Suppliers: from 30 KW to 500KW

prompt.content: Loan Amount that can be availed under NUST Ujala Finance?

completion.content:
i. Small Enterprise –  upto  Rs. 15 M
ii. Medium Enterprise – upto Rs. 25M
iii. Domestic users    - from Rs. 0.5M to Rs. 3.0M
iv. NUST employees: - upto Rs. 3.00M
v. Vendors/Suppliers:: From Rs. 5M to 25 Million – (Single Vendor)

prompt.content: What is the current Mark-up rate of NUST Ujala Finance?

completion.content:
6 % per annum for all
*Markup at 12M Kibor + 4% Per Annum to be charged till refinance claim reimbursed by SBP.

prompt.content: What is the maximum tenure for NUST Ujala Finance?

completion.content:
i. SE/ME borrowers:   05 years, inclusive of grace period of 03 months.
ii. Domestic : 05 years inclusive of grace period of 03 months.
iii. NUST employees : 10 years or as per remaining service period (whichever is lesser), inclusive of grace period of 03 months. 
iv. Vendors/Suppliers:  05 years inclusive of grace period of 06 months

prompt.content: What is the repayment frequency in NUST Ujala Finance?

completion.content:
SE/ME Borrowers       :  Monthly  / Quarterly
Domestic Borrower   :  Monthly 
NUST employees         : Monthly 
Vendors/Suppliers     : Quarterly/Half Yearly (as per borrower’s cash flow)

prompt.content: What are the processing charges for NUST Ujala Finance Application?

completion.content: SE/ME/Vendor/Supplier

prompt.content: Domestic Borrower

completion.content: NUST Employees

prompt.content: Is there any late payment charges?

completion.content: In case of delay of installment, commercial rate will be charges on overdue days.

prompt.content: What are the service/documentation/legal charges in NUST Ujala Finance?

completion.content: At actual

prompt.content: What are the insurance charges?

completion.content: At actual

prompt.content: Is NUST Bank offering any seasonal financing?

completion.content: Seasonal finance product "NUST Flour Mill Finance” has been structured through for quick financing under program-based lending. The product has been designed for Flour Mills in order to meet their working capital needs. NUST Flour Mill Finance caters to meet seasonal financing needs of wheat procurement and other overhead expenses to flour mills. The scope of product is to target flour mills which fall under category of SME.

prompt.content: For which purposes NUST Flour Mill Finance is being offered?

completion.content:
Cash Finance (CF)
To meet working capital requirements of flour mill business for procurement of wheat as per milling capacity

prompt.content: What are the Loan Limits of NUST Flour Mill Finance?

completion.content: Per party (single entity) can avail up to Rs. 75M for ME and Rs. 25M for SE

prompt.content: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in NUST Flour Mill Finance?

completion.content: Age of borrower (in case of sole-proprietorship) must be minimum 20 years, however age not to exceed 65 years at the time of application. This age can be relaxed in case of effective succession planning for business operations.

prompt.content: What is the maximum tenure of NUST Flour Mill Finance?

completion.content: Maximum 1 year as per clean-up corridors

prompt.content: What is the current Mark-up rate of NUST Flour Mill Finance?

completion.content:
Cash Finance
3 Months average KIBOR + 3% p.a.

prompt.content: Any Account turnover requirement for NUST Flour Mill Finance?

completion.content: Minimum 50% of applicant’s sales to be documented through account turnover with bank(s).

prompt.content: What are the processing charges for NUST Flour Mill Finance Application?

completion.content: Processing fee will be charged @ 0.15% of total limit(s) processed/approved or Rs. 25,000/- whichever is higher

prompt.content: What are the service/documentation/legal charges in NUST Flour Mill Finance?

completion.content: At actual

prompt.content: What are the insurance charges?

completion.content: At actual

prompt.content: Is NUST Bank offering any financing against liquid security?

completion.content: NUST Fauri Business Finance” has been introduced to provide a swift package to meet financial business needs of new to bank obligor. AFBF is offered to meet short, medium and long-term requirements of business. The finance will be provided to SMEs & Commercial for all the eligible sectors as per NUST credit policy manual.

prompt.content: What is the Eligibility Criteria for business entity in Ask Fauri Business Finance?

completion.content: All except individuals

prompt.content: Is there any business age requirement?

completion.content: No

prompt.content: What is the nature of financing offered under Ask Fauri Business Finance?

completion.content:
AFBF-1:   Running Finance
AFBF-2:   Term Loan
AFBF-3:   Letter of Guarantee
AFBF-4:   Letter of Credit – Sight / Usance

prompt.content: What is the current Mark-up rate of Ask Fauri Business Finance?

completion.content:
AFBF-1:  3MK /COD +1.50%
AFBF-2:  12 MK /COD +2.0%
AFBF-3:  As per SOC
AFBF-4:  As per SOC

prompt.content: What is the principal repayment frequency in Ask Fauri Business Finance?

completion.content:
AFBF-1:  At Maturity
AFBF-2:  Monthly / Quarterly
AFBF-3:  Upon expiry / redemption
AFBF-4:  Upon retirement

prompt.content: What is the markup repayment frequency in Ask Fauri Business Finance?

completion.content:
AFBF-1:  Monthly / Quarterly
AFBF-2:  Monthly / Quarterly
AFBF-3:  Upfront
AFBF-4:  Upfront

prompt.content: What is the maximum tenure of Ask Fauri Business Finance?

completion.content:
AFBF-1:   Up to 1 Year
AFBF-2:   Up to 3 Year
AFBF-3:   Up to 30 Months
AFBF-4:   At Sight / Usance period 120 days

prompt.content: What are the Loan Limits of Ask Fauri Business Finance?

completion.content: Max Rs. 200 Mn (For all products)

prompt.content: Is there any grace period allowed in any financing?

completion.content: Grace period of 3 months allowed for AFBF 2 (Term Loan Only)

prompt.content: In how many days the loan can be approved in Ask Fauri Business Finance?

completion.content: Turnaround time (TAT) for disposal off the approval is fixed to 03 days from the date of pre-approval completion of documents

prompt.content: What is the collateral requirment for Ask Fauri Business Finance?

completion.content:
•	NUST : Lien on NUST deposit CA/SA/ TDR, including 3rd party (LCY/FCY)
•	National Saving Certificates (NSC): (Lien over NSC including joint name/owner)

prompt.content: What are the processing charges for Ask Fauri Finance Application?

completion.content: Flat @ Rs. 3,000/- (at the time of initiating and on each renewal)

completion.content: Nil

prompt.content: Is NUST Bank Participating in PMYB & ALS?

completion.content: NUST Bank is actively participating in PMYB&ALS. It has been specially designed to provide self-employment opportunity to the unemployed youth of the country who have skills, knowledge, experience or willingness to start their own businesses on small to medium scale or expand existing business on vast scale.

prompt.content: For which purposes PMYB & ALS is being offered?

completion.content:
•	To start new business 
•	To expand existing business

completion.content:

•	Working capital / Production Loans

completion.content:
Tier 2
 Above Rs. 0.5M and up to Rs 1.5M

prompt.content: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in PMYB & ALS and any mandatory qualification/experience required?

completion.content: All Pakistanis aged between 21 and 45 are eligible to apply, however for IT/E-Commerce related businesses, the lower age limit will be 18 years (at least matriculation or equivalent education will be required)

prompt.content: What is the maximum tenure in PMYB & ALS?

completion.content: Long Term Loan:  Maximum 8 Years (Maximum 1 Year Grace Period)

prompt.content: What is the current Mark-up rate of PMYB & ALS?

completion.content:
Tier 2
     5% per annum

completion.content:
Tier 2
10% (New Business)

prompt.content: What is the repayment frequency in PMYB & ALS?

completion.content: Repayment of PMYB&ALS loans will be made in the form of “monthly or quarterly Instalments (or as per SBP’s directives)

prompt.content: What is the security requirement for availing PMYB & ALS?

completion.content:
Tier 2
i.	Clean; personal guarantee of the borrower
ii.	02 Post Dated cheques for installment amount 
iii.	01 Post Dated cheque for full loan amount plus mark up as per amortization schedule

completion.content: 25% of the loans will go to women borrowers

completion.content: PKR 1,000/- plus FED per instance per installment, grace period included. (Late Payment to be triggered 15 days after installment becomes due i.e. on day 16)

 Above Rs. 0.5M and up to Rs 1.5M

prompt.content: What is Home Remittance ?

completion.content: Home Remittance Service enables remitters to send money from abroad to Pakistan instantly, conveniently, and safely through the legal banking channel.

prompt.content: What types of Inward Home Remittance products does NUST Bank offer ?

completion.content:
NUST  offers the following Home Remittance Products to cater to the needs of various home remittance
beneficiaries in Pakistan:
• Cash Over the Counter (CoC) payments for walk-in customers
• NUST Account Transfer
• Other Bank Account Transfer via Inter Bank Funds Transfer (IBFT) & Real Time Gross Settlement (RTGS)

prompt.content: In which currency will I receive my remittance?

completion.content: All home remittance payments are disbursed in Pak Rupees.

prompt.content: Is there any limit on the amount received though NUST Home Remittance?

completion.content:
Below are the applicable limits:
• NUST Accounts - No Limit
• Other banks accounts - No Limit
• Cash Over the Counter (CoC) Transactions - Up to PKR 1,000,000/- per transaction and there is no limit of Western Union COC transactions

prompt.content: Are there any charges/fee for NUST's Home Remittance Service?

completion.content: NUST Home Remittance Service is free of charge.

prompt.content: Are there any tax deductions on Home Remittances?

completion.content: Home Remittance Service is free of taxes.

prompt.content: Can I receive remittance in Pakistan if I do not have a bank account with any bank?

completion.content: You can receive your home remittance from any of NUST 600+ domestic branches nationwide if you have a valid CNIC and Transaction Unique Reference No. / Pin code.

prompt.content: Is there any list of branches I can access to get information?

completion.content: The list of NUST domestic branches can be viewed from the Branch Locator available on our corporate website www.nustbank.com .

prompt.content: Who should I contact in case I need to lodge a complaint regarding Home Remittance?

completion.content:
For any query/complaint regarding Home Remittance, you may contact our dedicated Remittance Service Centre at UAN# 021-111-000-787. 
You may also email your queries/complaints at remittance@NUSTbank.com.pk

prompt.content: How can I obtain a Proceed Realization Certificate (PRC)/Encashment Certificate against remittance(s) received? Who should I contact?

completion.content:
Please find below contact details for obtaining a PRC and e-PRC:
 •  e-PRC option is also available at the NUST website https://secureportal.NUSTbank.com/eprc/customer to obtain a system generated PRC on your registered email address.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
 • Proceeds Realization Certificate (PRC) is issued from NUST Centralized Remittance Department. You may contact them at the following email addresses:
remittance.prc@NUSTbank.com.pk

prompt.content: Can I track my remittance status online?

completion.content: Yes, you can view the status of your remittance online through NUST Remittance Tracker by following link https://NUSTbank.com/services/alternate-delivery-channels/home-remittance-tracking/

prompt.content: What are NUST's Banking hours to avail home remittance services from NUST Branches?

completion.content:
Customers can avail home remittance services from NUST domestic branches during regular business hours appended below:
• Monday to Thursday: 09:00 am to 05:00 pm
• Friday: 09:00 am to 05:30 pm
• Saturday: 09:00 am to 01:30 pm (through selected branches)

prompt.content: Is it important to declare the purpose of the funds being sent to Pakistan?

completion.content: Yes, it is mandatory to provide purpose of funds being sent to Pakistan.

prompt.content: I am a foreign national, can I send money to Pakistan?

completion.content: Yes, you can.

prompt.content: Does the PRI comes under the laws of State Bank or Government?

completion.content: It is a joint initiative of  State Bank of Pakistan, Ministry of overseas Pakistanis and Ministry of Finance.

prompt.content: Can the Freelance payment  be made through PRI?

completion.content: Yes Freelance payments is allowed under specfic arrangemnts with Tie-ups with allowed purposes as per SBP guidelines.

prompt.content: What conversion rates will be applied on remittance?

completion.content: The same conversion rates will be applied at the time of sending the remittance. Affiliated bank or Exchange Company confirm the Conversion rates to Sender at the time of sending the remittance.

prompt.content: Does NUST Bank has specialized remittance Account as per SBP guideline?

completion.content: Yes NUST has remittance account name as Pak Wattan Remittance Account.

prompt.content: Who can open Pak Wattan Remittance Account?

completion.content: A Bonafide recipient of Home remittance (PRI) can open this account.

prompt.content: Can remittance be sent from anywhere to Pakistan?

completion.content:
Yes, remittance can be sent from around the globe to Pakistan through our agent Partners like Western Union, Mastercard, Dandelion Payments (RIA) etc. 
For more information please go through the below link:
